annotation: <history><entry><input>ssh user@arch-vm</input><output>Welcome to Arch Linux</output><annotation>Connecting to an Arch Linux virtual machine via SSH.</annotation></entry><entry><input>uname -r</input><output>6.3.1-arch1-1</output><annotation>Checking the kernel version of the Arch Linux VM.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo pacman -Syu</input><output>...updating system...</output><annotation>Updating the system packages to ensure everything is up-to-date.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo pacman -S vim</input><output>resolving dependencies...</output><annotation>Installing the `vim` text editor using the `pacman` package manager.</annotation></entry><entry><input>vim --version</input><output>VIM - Vi IMproved 8.2</output><annotation>Verifying the installation of `vim` by checking its version.</annotation></entry><entry><input>echo "This is a test file" > test.txt</input><output></output><annotation>Creating a new text file, `test.txt`, and writing content to it using output redirection.</annotation></entry><entry><input>cat test.txt</input><output>This is a test file</output><annotation>Displaying the contents of `test.txt` to verify the content.</annotation></entry><entry><input>mv test.txt ~/Documents/</input><output></output><annotation>Moving the `test.txt` file to the `Documents` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls</input><output></output><annotation>Listing the contents of the current directory to confirm `test.txt` has been moved.</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls ~/Documents</input><output>test.txt</output><annotation>Verifying that `test.txt` is now located in the `Documents` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>rm ~/Documents/test.txt</input><output></output><annotation>Removing `test.txt` from the `Documents` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls ~/Documents</input><output></output><annotation>Confirming that `test.txt` has been removed from the `Documents` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>exit</input><output></output><annotation>Exiting the SSH session after completing the file operations.</annotation></entry></history>
